column4: I have Radeon 9200 and I tried to get 3D working and it didn't go well.  Gave up until I get a lot smarter.
I'm not even trying to get 3D working.  Just trying for the full 1440x900 I had under ubuntu before my latest reinstall.  Any ideas?
not much of an expert, but I edited /etc/X11/xorg.conf manually and inserted 1600x1200 res that I wanted and I have that now.  It did not auto-detect my monitor correctly

thanks, I did that a few times and made sure the resulting xorg.conf doesn't have 1048x768 even in it and yet - there it is still in 1048x768.  Weird.  I also did autodetect and that produced a new and somewhat interesting xorg.conf but no change in video resolution in the display.  Almost like I'm editing the wrong xorg.conf (I checked).
maybe it falls back on the VESA driver and ignores the xorg.conf ?  I have no idea, sorry, just ignorant guessing
maybe - I'm pretty new to this level of the dungeon.
there be radeon dragons
you aren't kidding.  Lets hope their new owners (AMD), do follow through on hints of opening the source.
i think the radeon issues (for me) began when XFree86 switched to XOrg, but at least I'm actually back running linux now
what is the 3D supposed to do, not really 3D right?  Faster polygonal rendering?
i don't actually do any gaming, but my Firefox renders very slow, and I hate that
there are some firefox tweaks out there.  I tried them and they did wonders.  Should be available as an extension called fasterfox.
actually all the 2D window move/redraws are slow
for a minute there I actually thought the browser WAS the operating system

I can see how that could get old fast.  Can you try avoiding the problem by finding if there is a way to have window moves just be outlines?  Yes - Netscape was right but just to early with the slogan to save itself from M$'s heel.
not sure if window moves can be tweaked, but I'm too stubborn to change it.
I hope you win  and write it up!
can you tell me where one gets/finds 'aticonfig'?
gonna get a new MB with dual core and nvidia, because no computer is truly happy until it jumps right off the desk and finishes even before you tell it to begin
sounds like something we all need.  I just don't want it finishing my sentences for me.
i don't have aticonfig
but now that I know that others have it I want it
!  all the FAQs on drivers for ATI keep mentioning it.  Must be obvious but haven't stumbled into it.  thx
